main event: Several UFO sightings were reported in Tucson, Arizona in August 1952, including a bright, round, unidentified object seen maneuvering over a residence and a saucer-shaped object hovering motionless near Tucson airport.
interesting points: The sighting of a large, round, unidentified, brilliant, spherical object maneuvering over a residence by a pilot and his wife in Tucson, Arizona.

A metallic, bright, saucer-shaped object was observed hovering motionless near Tucson airport. The object appeared to be too large and bright to be a star, and its duration and speed did not fit the characteristics of a weather balloon.

The observation of a saucer-shaped object by an individual who noticed it while a plane was taking off from Tucson airport, approximately 75 miles east of Tucson. The object was described as being saucer-shaped and appeared to be hovering motionless.

A spherical object traveling at a speed of approximately 2002 MPH at an estimated altitude of 20,000 to 10,000 feet. The object was described as very bright, silvery-white in color, and appeared to have the brilliance and intensity of a landing light. It made a general northeast to southwest direction and stopped for a moment before speeding up rapidly and disappearing.
The witness of a metallic, elliptical object, about 30 to 60 feet in diameter, flying at an estimated speed of 400 to 500 knots at an altitude of approximately 40,000 feet in Tucson, Arizona.
sighted object: multiple unidentified flying objects including spherical and saucer-shaped objects
witnesses: multiple witnesses including a pilot, a military pilot, and a civilian
